result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin J Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court advises of possible further hearings if not complying with terms of probation.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must attend and complete anger management course and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - court has no objection to serving in Vilaw County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin J Fowler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Calvin J Fowler in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:50 AM. State - here for sentencing after revocation - State is just now reviewing the revocation packet as just received this AM. Richards has the revocation package - discrepency with credit stated on revocation paperwork. State - has complied with victim notification requirements - makes argument for sentencing - recommends 6 months in county jail with requirement that the defendant pay any restitution that may be due and owing. Richards - makes argument for sentencing - recommends a fine only. Fowler makes statement. State makes additional comment regarding AODA counseling. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 50 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed  - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - no objection to serving the sentence in Vilas County - report to jail 3/14/16 at 8:30 AM, enters civil judgement for any unpaid fees, right to appeal.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-09-2016 08:45 am

Defendant Calvin J Fowler in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:32 pm. Plead to count 2, count 1 & 3 DRI - joint recommendation w/hold and 12 months probation, restitution and costs, anger managements, employment/school, 50 hours of community service to be approved by P&P. State - has complied with victim notification requirements - agrees with recommendations as stated. State now instructed by Deputy Justice that the victim did wish to be here but is still comfortable proceeding today on the sentencing. Fowler agrees. Court dismisses and reads in count #1 and #3. Fowler pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Finlan makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Fowler withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: costs - set aside bond forfeiture and take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, attend and complete anger managment course and follow thru with all recommendation, 50 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, Court instructs on possible further hearings if not complying with terms of probation, give DNA sample and gives expungment rights on that, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial at 09-09-2015 02:30 pm

Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing at 09-09-2015 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial at 09-09-2015 02:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court telephonically with leave of the Court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:03 AM. Finlan is retained privately, has filed an Auth to Appear, waives reading of the complaint, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts auth to appear, accepts NG pleas, sets for FPT. Finaln makes verbal objection to bail bond forfeiture. Court accepts objection and sets for bail bond forfeiture hearing on same date and time.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Calvin J Fowler in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:27 AM. Court questions the defendant why he is not here with an attorney. Fowler stated that he droped off paperwork for an attorney. Fowler states he is currently employed. Recess to talk to SPD and given court appointed paperwork in Court. Recalled at 9:55 AM with Mary Burns. Burns states the defendant does not qualify for SPD, recess to fill out court appointed paperwork. Court appoints an attorney for the defendant, paid back at rate of $200.00/month commencing 8/1/15/CO. Fowler takes paperwork to JA to get attorney appointed.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

When bond was done on 6/24/15 the wrong amount was done. Should have been $1000 signature bond and I did $2500 sig bond. Will have to be corrected at next hearing as defendant was already released from jail.

Defendant Calvin J Fowler not in court, defendant in custody via video from FOSO and without counsel.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:13 am. Defendant forgot about the date previously set. Court advises of charges, penalties and rights, right to attorney, DNA sample/expunction. Defendant wants attorney however feels he could represent himself. Defendant makes statement regarding charges. Court advises of SPD appointment and court appointed attorney process. Court warns on having attorney at next hearing - must call SPD today - complaint will be sent to the jail for defendant. Court advises of right to object to forfeiture. State - wants to know where defendant is residing. Fowler will reside with his mother at N 2878 Wikihsahtek Neopit WI. State asks for bond to be set at $500 cash. Fowler asks for lower amount for stated reasons. Court $1000 sig bond with no consumption and no contact with AW (victim). $250 still subject to forfeiture. If objects to forfeiture must notify court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 09:15 am.
